tasksCompleted: Fixed Terraform CI/CD YAML so plan and artifact upload run as separate steps
Standardised Terraform plan artifact naming (tfplan-dev/test) and wiring into apply job
Verified separate remote state keys for dev and test environments
Implemented safe RG import logic in CI using az + terraform state checks
challenges: GitHub Actions YAML indentation caused plan and upload steps not to run as real steps
Apply job failing because tfplan artifact was never uploaded
Historical state/import confusion around dev/test RGs made error messages noisy
learnings: GitHub Actions step indentation is critical â€“ - name: must not live inside run: blocks
Terraform imports belong in one-off fixes, not as repeated actions in CI unless very carefully controlled
Using stable artifact names and matching download names avoids a whole class of CI failures
Remote state keys per environment make debugging state issues much easier
dailyLogs.notes: Today focused on stabilising the Terraform CI/CD pipeline with proper plan/apply separation, artifact handling, and safe RG import behaviour. Dev and test environments are now wired cleanly into the workflow, setting up a solid base for further RBAC and environment work.
